column4: would like /dev/sda2 to boot using grub and kernel off of live 8.04.  can anyone help me with this?
was thining, copy /boot from cd, to sda2, then run grub-install /dev/sda2  . that does not seem to work
Does sda2 all ready have an OS installed in it?
And out of curiosity then, why are you trying to install Grub to that partition if it has no OS?
have / dir, but they are empty
trying to do a ground up install
Are you planning on installing a OS to that partition at some point?
peace by peace.  will start with some bin files then start adding souce for programs
should i be able to get a kernal to boot off the drive like that?

Well I don't think just copying over the /boot directory from your liveCD to your sda2 partition will work. You need to formally install Grub to that partition. And about the kernel, depends probably how you put it there--a simple copy won't likely work.
grub should just boot on its own, even if i do not have a kernal, right?
If you have Grub installed correctly, I believe the answer is yes.
That command will not work I don't think--that command is used to install grub into the MBR, not a partition.
I think you would be better off asking in #grub, but that's just an idea. :)
No problem, good luck with it.
